roleset.name: to decorate, beautify
roleset.note: GRACE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'grace' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from grace.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: transitive
example.text: Besides that , some of the paintings that [*T*-1]-2 were [*-2]to grace the walls of CenTrust actually ended up [*-3] hanging in the chairman 's estate on La Gorce Isle off Miami Beach .

roleset.name: characterized by kindness, courteousness, generosity
roleset.note: GRACIOUS-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. (from gracious.01-j)

example.name: With gracious action
example.text: It *EXP* might have been slightly more GRACIOUS of him to pay tribute to the work of my right hon. Friend the Prime Minister.
example.arg: to pay tribute to the work of my right hon. Friend the Prime Minister.

example.name: With topic
example.text: He 'd taken her to church , he 'd taken her to lunch and she had n't been particularly GRACIOUS about any of it

example.name: With target
example.text: "Your ancestors were GRACIOUS to their servants , Nuadu of the Silver Arm , " he said , sneeringly .
